problems.title: Integer Replacement (Bit Manipulation)
problems.description:
Problem Statement

Given a positive integer n, you can apply one of the following operations:

If n is even, replace n with n / 2.
If n is odd, replace n with either n + 1 or n - 1.

Return the minimum number of operations needed for n to become 1.
problems.examples:
Sample Input
8

Sample Output
3

Explanation: 8 -> 4 -> 2 -> 1

Sample Input
7

Sample Output
4

Explanation: 7 -> 8 -> 4 -> 2 -> 1
or 7 -> 6 -> 3 -> 2 -> 1

Sample Input
4

Sample Output
2

Explanation: 4 -> 2 -> 1
hintsList: For odd numbers, prefer n-1 if (n+1)/2 is even, otherwise prefer n+1.
Use bit manipulation to check if (n+1)/2 or (n-1)/2 is even.
